docs.lead_paragraph: The state that pioneered the open primary, income taxes and unemployment compensation has now devised a novel approach for addressing teen-age pregnancy. A wide-ranging law adopted unanimously by the State Legislature last month provides for sex education in public schools, grants for programs to counsel teen-agers, abortions without the necessity of parental consent and the establishment of a state adoption center. But what has caught the attention of most Wisconsin parents and teen-agers is a section known as the ''grandparents liability law.'' Under this law, parents of teen-agers who have babies are now legally obligated to provide financial support for those babies ''so far as the parent is able'' and the teen-ager is not. The obligation would continue until the teen-ager turns 18 years old, marries or joins the military. This portion of the Abortion Prevention and Family Responsibility Act of 1985 is being hailed and damned in equal measure, and all before it has actually been implemented in any concrete way.

headline.main: FOR PARENTS OF PREGNANT CHILDREN, NEW LIABILITY

docs.lead_paragraph: ONE of the greatest stumbling blocks to curbing lead poisoning on Long Island is the lax enforcement of county laws banning lead-solder use in home plumbing, according to engineers and building officials. ''We need better monitoring of the plumbers who are trying to beat the system,'' said to Norman Murrell, a consulting engineer in Melville. ''From our findings and independent studies, approximately 60 percent of the plumbers are cheating.'' Kenneth Christensen, a member of the Huntington plumbing board that regulates and establishes licensing requirements, said that he was not sure the cheating was that widespread, but that he was aware of some in his town. ''The plumbers have been alerted to the fact that lead solder is a violation,'' Mr. Christensen said, ''but there may be a doubt in some plumbers' minds as to the problems it can cause since they may have been using it for many years.'' Lead solder is cheaper than substitutes, he added.

headline.main: RULE ON LEAD IN PIPES IGNORED
